title: 1985년 Percy Leo Dobard v. W.E. Johnson, Warden, Holman Correctional Institution 사건
summary: 미국 USA, Federal 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: Percy Leo Dobard v. W.E. Johnson, Warden, Holman Correctional Institution. 판결일: 1985-02-11. 법원: Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: Percy Leo DOBARD, Petitioner-Appellant, v. W.E. JOHNSON, Warden, Holman Correctional Institution, Respondent-Appellee
**판결일**: 1985-02-11
**법원**: Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit
**관할**: USA, Federal

**판사**: Clark, Godbold, Thomas

## 변호인

Ralph I. Knowles, Jr., Tuscaloosa, Ala., Barry Friedman, Davis, Polk & Wardwell, Washington, D.C., for petitioner-appellant., Edward Carnes, Asst. Atty. Gen., Montgomery, Ala., for respondent-appellee.

## 인용

- 749 F.2d 1503

## 판결문 요약

749 F.2d 1503
    Percy Leo DOBARD, Petitioner-Appellant,v.W.E. JOHNSON, Warden, Holman Correctional Institution,Respondent-Appellee.
    No. 84-7281.
    United States Court of Appeals,Eleventh Circuit.
    Jan. 8, 1985.Rehearing and Rehearing En Banc Denied Feb. 11, 1985.
    
      Ralph I. Knowles, Jr., Tuscaloosa, Ala., Barry Friedman, Davis, Polk & Wardwell, Washington, D.C., for petitioner-appellant.
      Edward Carnes, Asst. Atty. Gen., Montgomery, Ala., for respondent-appellee.
      Appeal from the United States District Court for the Northern District of Alabama.
      Before GODBOLD, Chief Judge, CLARK, Circuit Judge, and THOMAS*, District Judge.
      GODBOLD, Chief Judge:
    
    
      1
      Under 28 U.S.C. Sec. 2241 (1982) a state prisoner may file a petition for habeas corpus in the federal judicial district in which he is in custody or in the district in which the court was held that convicted and sentenced him.1   The provision permitting filing in the district of conviction and sentence was added by amendment in 1966.2
    
    
      2
      Petitioner is an Alabama death-sentenced prisoner who was convicted and sentenced to death for murdering a police officer.  Because of pretrial publicity the venue for petitioner's trial was transferred from the state court in the county of indictment to the state court in an adjoining county, and petitioner was tried and convicted in the adjoining county.  Some of the incidents of sentencing were, in the phys...
